id: A. Curing Method and Initial Setup

text: Curing method complies with specifications and CSA A23.1 (wet, membrane, insulated blankets, etc.)
Curing started immediately after placement (within specified time window)
Curing method appropriate for weather conditions (e.g., insulation in cold weather)
Water curing systems (sprays, soaked burlap) applied uniformly
Membrane curing compound applied per manufacturer specs (thickness, coverage)
Curing maintained for required duration (e.g., 3/7 days minimum or per mix spec)
Concrete surfaces protected from wind, direct sun, freezing, or early drying
Curing records maintained (start/end times, temperatures, type)
Minimum time for form stripping verified (slabs, beams, walls) per engineer or spec
No damage to edges, surfaces, or corners during stripping
Form removal done carefully without impact on structural members
Soffit/form supports removed only after strength confirmation (test reports or site direction)
Honeycombing, voids, and defects checked post-stripping
All form tie holes, patching, and surface repair completed as per spec
Surface treatment applied if required (e.g., sealers, hardeners)
QA/QC approved stripped surfaces and authorized for subsequent works

id: • CSA A23.1 – Methods of Curing Concrete
